DOCNAME: CASE OF MERTER AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first and second applicants were born in DATE and DATE . The remaining applicants did not inform the Court of their dates of birth . They all live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the owner of the neighbouring plot of land ( “ the neighbour ” ) brought an action in ORG of First Instance against the applicants ' ancestor , PERSON , claiming that the actual area of his land exceeded the amount indicated in the land registry records . He further claimed that , since the actual boundaries were not clear between his and the neighbouring plot of land , the applicants ' ancestor was interfering with his use of the property ( men - i müdahale davası ) . He therefore requested the court to resolve this dispute by determining the correct boundaries between the plots of land and ordering the accurate registration thereof .

CARDINAL . On DATE , as a result of the construction of a road passing through the land in question , ORG carried out a land survey in PERSON . The records concerning the plot in question were amended as a result of this exercise . Following this amendment , the plot in question was divided into CARDINAL different parts , namely , plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL . Plot no . CARDINAL was allocated as meadowland and registered in the name of the ORG . It was decided that plots nos . CARDINAL , FAC , CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be entered in the land register in the name of the applicants ' ancestor and plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the name of the neighbour . No dispute arose with regard to plot no . CARDINAL , therefore this allocation became final and the plot in question was registered in the name of the applicants ' ancestor .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , following the above registration process and the establishment of ORG , ORG of First Instance issued a decision of non - jurisdiction and transferred this lawsuit to ORG . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG designated PERSON and PERSON as the heirs ( “ the heirs ” ) of PERSON following his death .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of the heirs , plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the name of the ORG , and plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the name of the neighbour . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and remitted the case to ORG .

CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG , GPE and the heirs of CARDINAL other persons intervened in the proceedings . Relying on the NORP land registry records ( temessük kayıtları ) , they claimed ownership rights over the plots in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant , PERSON , also intervened in the proceedings before ORG as a testamentary heir .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG decided that plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of the applicants ( as heirs of PERSON ) and plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the names of GPE and the ORG respectively . The court also held that plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of the heirs of the neighbour . The court further allowed the request to intervene by the heirs of PERSON who stated that their ancestor had partially maintained the last - mentioned plots in his possession before the proceedings had begun . The total number of parties to the proceedings increased to DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE for non - compliance with the procedure for the announcement of the judgment . It further considered that the examination conducted by the first - instance court was insufficient and that the court should have considered the de facto possession of these plots of land .

CARDINAL . On DATE , having conducted a land survey and with reference to an expert report , ORG set aside its decision concerning the registration of plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL and CARDINAL in the names of the applicants . Following its examination of the NORP land registry records ( temessük kayıtları ) , the court ruled that the aforementioned plots should be registered in the names of the heirs of PERSON , son of PERSON , and that plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of GPE and the ORG respectively . The court also held that plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of the heirs of the neighbour .
CARDINAL . It is to be noted that this judgment was not served on the first applicant , PERSON , but on his legal representative , who had died in DATE ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . In a decision dated DATE ORG upheld the above judgment in part and quashed the remainder . It reasoned that the examination conducted by ORG had been insufficient because it had given judgment despite contradictory expert reports and witness statements . It further reasoned that the court had also failed to verify whether some of the documentary evidence was genuine . ORG held in particular that ORG had erred in its finding concerning the registration of plots CARDINAL . CARDINAL and CARDINAL . However , it upheld the judgment of DATE with regard to plots nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL . It further dismissed a rectification request by the parties on DATE . Thus , while the judgment became final in respect of the aforementioned plots , the dispute continued as regards plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , relying on the NORP land registry records , decided that PERCENT of plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in the names of the heirs of PERSON and PERCENT in the name of ORG , who had purchased part of the plots from ORG . The court further noted that the heirs of PERSON ( the applicants ' ancestor ) had failed to prove their possession of the plots for DATE .

CARDINAL . It is to be noted that the first applicant , PERSON , was not a party to the above proceedings , although the remaining CARDINAL applicants , as heirs of PERSON , were noted as litigants in the court 's above - mentioned judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal lodged by the heirs of the neighbour , GPE and the ORG against the above decision . It also rejected a rectification request by the appellants on DATE . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE thus became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants brought an action in ORG asking for the proceedings to be reopened ( iade - i muhakeme ) on the basis of newly discovered documentary evidence . They claimed that plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL should be registered in their names .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicants ' request to reopen the proceedings . ORG upheld this judgment on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant applied to ORG claiming that the judgment of DATE had been served on his legal representative who had died in DATE and that he had not been able to learn of it in time to appeal within the statutory time - limit . He therefore asked the court to serve the said judgment on him and to grant him leave to appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the first applicant 's requests on the grounds that the judgment in question had been communicated to the parties and had already been enforced . The first applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment of DATE on the ground that the case file did not contain any information or document indicating that the judgment in question had been duly served on the first applicant . It therefore granted the first applicant leave to appeal but , after re - examining the case , dismissed his appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant 's request for rectification of its decision of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the information given by the ORG , on DATE the applicants brought a new action in ORG asking for the proceedings to be reopened . The applicants ' action was communicated to the parties ( CARDINAL persons ) and the proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on an unspecified date , the applicants filed another action with ORG claiming compensation from ORG ( tapu sicil müdürlüğü ) . The applicants alleged that they had sustained damage on account of the negligence and mistakes made by the defendant in keeping the land registry records . These proceedings were suspended pending the outcome of the proceedings before ORG .
CARDINAL . It is to be noted that the applicants did not provide any information or raise any complaints about the proceedings pending before ORG and ORG .
